title: Ownership Structure of KLA Corp Stock

content.text: As of the latest available data, institutional investors own a significant portion of KLA Corp stock. The largest institutional shareholder is The Vanguard Group, with a stake of about 9.50%. Other major institutional investors include BlackRock, State Street Corporation, and Fidelity Management & Research Company.

Insider ownership refers to the shares held by the company's executives, directors, and other insiders. According to the latest filings, insider ownership of KLA Corp stands at approximately 0.20%. The largest insider shareholder is CEO Richard P. Wallace, who holds around 0.06% of the company's shares.

Apart from institutional investors and insiders, there are several major shareholders who hold a significant stake in KLA Corp. The top three major shareholders, after discounting institutional and insider ownership, are The Capital Group Companies, Inc., with a stake of approximately 10.20%, followed by ClearBridge Investments, LLC, with a stake of about 6.80%. Another major shareholder is The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation, with a stake of around 5.80%.

news.headline: 1 Cheap Dividend Chip Stock With Big Upside From AI and Electric Vehicles
news.summary: Shares of semiconductor-manufacturing equipment company KLA (NASDAQ: KLAC) have been a top-notch investment, with the stock soaring to new all-time highs this year.  KLA is one of the "fab five" -- the five specialist companies that dominate the market for equipment to make semiconductor wafers.  This equipment is especially important for quality control when a new chip manufacturing line fires up.

news.headline: KLA Corporation's (NASDAQ:KLAC) Q1 Sales Top Estimates, Next Quarter Sales Guidance Is Optimistic
news.summary: Maker of equipment for semiconductor manufacturing KLA Corporation (NASDAQ:KLAC) reported Q1 FY2024 results topping analysts' expectations, with revenue down 12% year on year to $2.4 billion. Guidance for next quarter's revenue was also optimistic at $2.45 billion at the midpoint, 2.81% above analysts' estimates. Turning to EPS, KLA Corporation made a non-GAAP profit of $5.74 per share, down from its profit of $7.06 per share in the same quarter last year.

news.headline: KLA Corporation Reports Fiscal 2024 First Quarter Results
news.summary: KLA Corporation (NASDAQ: KLAC) today announced financial and operating results for its first quarter of fiscal year 2024, which ended on Sept. 30, 2023, and reported GAAP net income of $741.4 million and GAAP earnings per diluted share of $5.41 on revenue of $2.40 billion.
